intro: Lepidocoma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. Lepidocoma produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
